Text: Gathering agreementWestport Oil and Gas Company Inc has agreed to terms for Enron providing gathering from the inlet of screw compression to Glenrock I am faxing to you a term sheet so that we can get Westport a gathering agreement asap You can use the latest Quantum agreement as a start We are NOT purchasing the gas Call me with questions Mike

Re Gathering agreement Please review the attached redline version which includes my suggested revisions let me know what you think Thanks for the quick turnaround it seems very important and appreciated by Westport Mike

WestportWestport will go along with breaking up the service into field gathering gathering and compression Let me know where to go from here Is this just a matter of changing everything back the way it was with the exception of the Gathering Fee section and responding to their other changes Mike

Re WestportThe breakout of for field gathering for compression plus actual fuel and shrink and for Ft Union gathering works for me The last line of Section is a problem We cannnot guarantee a Feb date I would like to put that we will endeavor to install the facilities as quickly as conditions allow after the required permits are received by Enron Section I dont agree with daysI would settle on days In the General Terms and Conditions definitions we need to leave dehydrator fuel and dehydrating terms in under Equivalent Quantities and Gathering Under Quality the by volume of total inerts must stay Let me know what you have a problem with Thanks Mike Enron North America Corp From Dan J Hyvl ECT PM To Michael J NRON cc Subject Re Westport Yes Let me know if you agree with their breakout of the fee components If so I will change the agreement back and incorporate their other changes for comment Michael J NRON AM To Dan J CT cc Subject Westport Dan Westport will go along with breaking up the service into field gathering gathering and compression Let me know where to go from here Is this just a matter of changing everything back the way it was with the exception of the Gathering Fee section and responding to their other changes Mike

Re WestportWe may change the wire transfer to a checkI am trying to find out why they dont want to use the wire transfer option On section I do not want to add the proposed sentences Section I am explaining to WestPort that this would only be done fo good and reasonable cause Section Do we have a problem making the assignment language bi lateral Section I am trying to find out why they want to add the sentence Mike Enron North America Corp From Dan J Hyvl ECT AM To Michael J NRON cc Subject Re Westport Mike Are we sticking with wire transfer as the method for payment I assume that we are Section Pressures Is there any need to include the two sentences they proposed at the end of that section I assume there is not I see no need to make any of the changes proposed in Sections Do you agree Assuming you are okay with the above I have attached a revised contract both redline and clean for your review Michael J NRON PM To Dan J CT cc Subject Re Westport Dan The breakout of for field gathering for compression plus actual fuel and shrink and for Ft Union gathering works for me The last line of Section is a problem We cannnot guarantee a Feb date I would like to put that we will endeavor to install the facilities as quickly as conditions allow after the required permits are received by Enron Section I dont agree with daysI would settle on days In the General Terms and Conditions definitions we need to leave dehydrator fuel and dehydrating terms in under Equivalent Quantities and Gathering Under Quality the by volume of total inerts must stay Let me know what you have a problem with Thanks Mike Enron North America Corp From Dan J Hyvl ECT PM To Michael J NRON cc Subject Re Westport Yes Let me know if you agree with their breakout of the fee components If so I will change the agreement back and incorporate their other changes for comment Michael J NRON AM To Dan J CT cc Subject Westport Dan Westport will go along with breaking up the service into field gathering gathering and compression Let me know where to go from here Is this just a matter of changing everything back the way it was with the exception of the Gathering Fee section and responding to their other changes Mike

WestPortHere is the latest Westport contract with a few changes I need you to take a look at Also in Section what are payment securities They would like this to be defined They also would like Section to be bilateral One other question Westport has is If the delivery point screw compressor meter is off the acreage lease can all the fees be charged back to the royalty owners I told them you may not want to give an opinion on this and they are alright with that Let me know your thoughts on all the above Mike

Use this oneDelete the other email I sent and use this one This is the latest and greatest I changed Gatherer to Provider and Gathering Service to Field Services I deleted the last sentence in Section Pressures Let me know if this is a problem This line was added to other agreements at the request of those parties Hope you had a GREAT weekend Mike

DraftHyvl How the heck are you Thanks for the quick turnaround on the Westport contracts I am hoping Bierbach will sign them this week and I will get one of the originals back to you ASAP and get the other original to Westport I need a draft copy of the latest gathering agreement and purchase agreement so that True Oil Company can start to review them We do not have a deal done with them YET but they would like to start reviewing the contracts Let me know if this is a problem Mike

DraftsAttached are the Draft Gathering and Purchase Agreements We have made a few minor changes which I am sending to you on a hard copy If you dont have a problem with the changes these should be the base draft agreements we will use Let me know Mike

Purchase AgreementWe have a customer True Oil Company that would like us to gather and buy their gas in the Powder River They do not want a gathering agreement They only want a purchase agreement They are willing to commit that the reserves will flow through Enrons facilities but do not want to sign a gathering agreement We do not want to purchase their gas for an agreed to rate for more than one year We want the reopener in the purchase agreement Their idea is that we would purchase the gas at CIG index minus and if Enron is not purchasing the gas that a third party will have to paynegotiate with Enron for the gathering The minus would include all gathering field and Ft Union fuel shrink margin etc Do you have any thoughts on this Mike Also on the Appendix of the purchase agreement Force Majeure I think we can take out the last line that talks about YK related problems On Exhibit D for Scott Sitters address the street number should come before Denver Co I know I did this

True Oil purchase contractAttached is a redlined version of a purchase agreement for True Oil Company Please review and let me know whats good and whats not NOTES True Oil will probably become an LLC sometime this year Does that change anything In Article True would like to know why that should be in there if we are not lending money to them and they do not owe us money Article I added this They would like some language added that gives them the right to put compression in at their expense and the purchase price renegotiated should this article come into play Article Force Majeure Why is force majeure here and in the definitions Can one or the other be deleted Article True would like to know why there are setoffs here if we owe them Article Is this paragraph necessary Supposedly True has not seen this paragraph in any other contract Article filing of the Notice of Gas Contract Where would this be filed and why General Provisions Sellers Representative Matters I assume that the first sentence authorized agent takes care of the Committed Reserses that True does not have ownership to In other words they cannot commit ownership that they do not have Exhibit F I added this Exhibit The very last sentence about pulsation If ENA is purchasing the gas at the inlet of the screw compressorwe are supplying the compression should this be deleted Call with any questions comments concerns or if you just want to say HI Take care Mike

WestportThe agreement you sent me was not the final agreement signed by Westport The one they signed see attached was a Field Services agreement not a Gathering Services agreement I made the changes to the attached in Section Let me know if you are ok with them Do we need to have the whole agreement signed or can the one page just be changed Mike
WestportIs the attached ok with you Mike
Westportwont go away Westport feels that they need the agreement amended Therefore I have prepared the attached for your review Let me know what you think Mike

FW ContractHere is a redlined version from Westport I have not looked at it yet except I see they want to call this Transportation service Im sure this is a problem we will have to address Let me know what you think Mike Forwarded by Michael J LeglerHOUECT on PM on PM To Michael J nron cc Subject FW Contract Westport Gathering Services doc Original Message From Michael J Legler SMTP Sent Thursday December PM To Subject Contract Mike Just to show the Holiday spirit the edit are in RED Westport Gathering Services doc Jeff I assume your received the contract by email on Tuesday and you and your legal folks are reviewing it If there are any questions call me at Thanks Mike Westport Gathering Services doc Westport Gathering Services doc

Huber Term Sheet Cc Gerald Nemec Attached is the term sheet for your review Dan and Debra This term sheet would be incorporated into the confirm under the Master Firm Purchase Agreement that Debra would prepare for JM Huber Corporation

True Oil purchase contractAttached is a redlined version of a purchase agreement for True Oil Company Please review and let me know whats good and whats not NOTES True Oil will probably become an LLC sometime this year Does that change anything In Article True would like to know why that should be in there if we are not lending money to them and they do not owe us money Article I added this They would like some language added that gives them the right to put compression in at their expense and the purchase price renegotiated should this article come into play Article Force Majeure Why is force majeure here and in the definitions Can one or the other be deleted Article True would like to know why there are setoffs here if we owe them Article Is this paragraph necessary Supposedly True has not seen this paragraph in any other contract Article filing of the Notice of Gas Contract Where would this be filed and why General Provisions Sellers Representative Matters I assume that the first sentence authorized agent takes care of the Committed Reserses that True does not have ownership to In other words they cannot commit ownership that they do not have Exhibit F I added this Exhibit The very last sentence about pulsation If ENA is purchasing the gas at the inlet of the screw compressorwe are supplying the compression should this be deleted Call with any questions comments concerns or if you just want to say HI Take care Mike

Huber Term Sheet Cc Gerald Nemec Attached is the term sheet for your review Dan and Debra This term sheet would be incorporated into the confirm under the Master Firm Purchase Agreement that Debra would prepare for JM Huber Corporation

Purchase AgreementWe have a customer True Oil Company that would like us to gather and buy their gas in the Powder River They do not want a gathering agreement They only want a purchase agreement They are willing to commit that the reserves will flow through Enrons facilities but do not want to sign a gathering agreement We do not want to purchase their gas for an agreed to rate for more than one year We want the reopener in the purchase agreement Their idea is that we would purchase the gas at CIG index minus and if Enron is not purchasing the gas that a third party will have to paynegotiate with Enron for the gathering The minus would include all gathering field and Ft Union fuel shrink margin etc Do you have any thoughts on this Mike Also on the Appendix of the purchase agreement Force Majeure I think we can take out the last line that talks about YK related problems On Exhibit D for Scott Sitters address the street number should come before Denver Co I know I did this

FW Cabo Baby yeahBOYS Original Message From Karen ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESKarenCkennedywipavcnEcomE NRONc om Sent Tuesday May AM To Legler Michael J Bump Dan J Subject Cabo Baby yeah Hi guys I will be sending your tickets to Cabo very soon You decided not to take Kennedy Scareways huh You all and John will be leaving out of Denver on Air Mexicana on Thursday July th at pm You will arrive in Cabo at pm Its nonstop You will return on Sunday July You will leave Cabo at am and arrive in Denver at pm Houston to Cabo flights were very full and in fact we were lucky to find this one Gerald Nemec will leave Houston on AeroMexico on Thursday July th at pm and arrive in Mexico City at pm He will depart Mexico City at and arrive in Cabo at pm He will leave Cabo on July th at pm arriving in Mexico City at pm He will depart Mexico City at pm and arrive in Houston at pm Denver and Houston will arrive in Cabo at the same time The return Gerald will leave two hours later than you If Gerald is unhappy with this schedule out travel agents phone number is Her name is Wendy If I can help give me a call Karen
KennedyI spoke with Ruth yesterday and she said they are working on the division of interest and once that is done they will have the exhibit for us She thought it would be a couple of weeks Mike

Fw re THE TRUTH ABOUT DRINKING BEER the smartest thing Cliff EVER said on Cheers One afternoon at Cheers Cliff Clavin was explaining the buffalo Theory to his buddy Norm And heres how it went Well ya see Norm its like thisA herd of buffalo can only move as fast as the slowest buffalo And when the herd is hunted it is the slowest and weakest ones at the back that are killed first This natural selection is good for the herd as a whole because the general speed and health of the whole group keeps improving by the regular killing of the weakest members In much the same way the human brain can only operate as fast as the slowest brain cells Excessive intake of alcohol as we all know kills brain cells but naturally it attacks the slowest and weakest brain cells first In this way regular consumption of beer eliminates the weaker brain cells making the brain a faster and more efficient machine Thats why you always feel smarter after a few beers

The importance of typing your email addresses corr ectly Forwar dedFW Fwd Fwd The importance of typing your email addresses correctly It seems there was this couple from Minneapolis who decided to go to Florida for a few days to thaw out during this particularly cold winter Since both spouses worked they had difficulty coordinating their schedules so the decision was made to have the husband leave for Florida on a certain day with the wife following him one day later The man made it down to Florida and arrived at his hotel Upon getting to his room he decided to open his laptop and send his wife back in Minneapolis an email However he left off one letter in typing his wifes email address and sent the email off without realizing his error In another part of the country a widow had just returned from the funeral of her husband a Methodist pastor of many years who had been called to glory just a few days earlier She decided to check her email because she was expecting to hear from her husbands relatives and friends Upon reading the first email she let out a loud scream fainted and fell to the floor The womans son rushed into the room and found his mother on the floor He glanced up at the computer screen and saw the following email message To My Loving Wife Ive just been checked in Everything has been prepared for your arrival here tomorrow Looking forward to seeing you then Your Devoted Husband PS Sure is hot down here
